page.title: 09Education-voluntary groups
page.content: Both Cliffe and Hemingbrough have organisations which provide educational opportunities for young people. In{Cliffe}the{Youth Club}is funded by the North Yorkshire Education Committee which provides paid leaders. In{Hemingbrough}the {Youth Club}is run on entirely voluntary lines and meets in the Methodist School Room. In Cliffe there is a{Girls' Brigade which meets each week whilst in Hemingbrough there is a{Brownie Pack and a separate{Girl Guide Company. Both meet weekly except in the holidays. For Cubs and Scouts boys have to travel outside the area to Osgodby or Barlby. For adults there is a Music Appreciation Society and a Local History Group in Hemingbrough.
